did.unittitle: Winston Churchill letter to Jesse Merritt
did.abstract: One 1943 typewritten letter from Winston Churchill to Jesse Merritt concerning a previous letter Merritt had sent about Sir George Downing's connection to 10 Downing Street and an unnamed university.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single item.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Winston Churchill (1874-1965) was a British politician who led Great Britain as Prime Minister during World War II (1939-1945).
Jesse Merritt (1889-1957) was a Quaker resident of Farmingdale in Nassau County, Long Island, N.Y. He was a historian of the Nassau County region and President of Bethpage Press in Farmingdale.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Winston Churchill letter to Jesse Merritt, 1977.411, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One brief typewritten letter from Winston Churchill (1874-1965) to Jesse Merritt (1889-1957) concerning a previous letter Merritt had sent about Sir George Downing's connection to 10 Downing Street (the headquarters of the British Prime Minister) and an unnamed university. The letter is dated September 14, 1943 and signed by Churchill.
